thread.title: Bossier man arrested after daughter critically injured
thread.title_full: Bossier man arrested after daughter critically injured - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Bossier man arrested after daughter critically injured
text:
BOSSIER CITY, La. (AP) - Bossier City police have arrested a man after his infant daughter was hospitalized.
Police say the 3-month-old girl's injuries are consistent with shaken baby syndrome.
The father, 27-year-old Sean Christopher Morton of Bossier City, was jailed early Saturday. He faces a charge of second-degree cruelty to a juvenile. He was awaiting the setting of bond. Information on whether he has an attorney was not available.
Morton was arrested after he took the child to Willis-Knighton Bossier's emergency room, where the staff alerted police.
The girl was later taken to University Health in Shreveport where she was listed in critical condition.
